question: Assume that source S and destination D are connected through two intermediate routers labeled R. Determine how many times each packet has to visit the network layer and the data link layer during a transmission from S to D. [GATE : 2013] S R R D

options.A: Network layer – 4 times and Data link layer – 4 times
options.B: Network layer – 4 times and Data link layer – 3 times
options.C: Network layer – 4 times and Data link layer – 6 times
options.D: Network layer – 2 times and Data link layer – 6 times

question: In the following pairs of OSI protocol layer/sub-layer and its functionality, the INCORRECT pair is [GATE : 2014]

options.B: Data Link Layer and Bit synchronization
options.C: Transport layer and End-to-end process communication
options.D: Medium Access Control sub-layer and Channel sharing

question: Which of the following options is/are TRUE?

options.A: Every layer of OSI model include header which keeps information of protocols implemented inside layer.
options.B: OSI model define three kind of addressing modes to send data packet from one node to another.
options.C: Internet protocol (IP) does not implement error control or flow control, to remove above issues it must be paired with TCP.
options.D: Different layers have different name of packets due to different header size. Self-Practice Questions :

question: Which of the following option is NOT TRUE about protocol?

options.A: It is a set of rules followed by each node in network.
options.B: It is implemented inside header of data packet.
options.C: It is a program written at different layers to do specific task.
options.D: It is used to design OSI model.

question: Which of the following options is/are TRUE about header?

options.A: All the protocols are implemented inside header.
options.B: Header size can not be greater than size of data.
options.C: Some of the layer may not include header.
options.D: No packet can travel into the network without header.

question: Which one of the protocol is NOT associated with physical Layer?

options.C: Circuit switching (D) Network topology (E) Access control

question: Which of the following options is/are TRUE?

options.A: MAC-address is used to identify a particular host inside network.
options.B: IP-address is used to identify a host.
options.C: Port-address is used to identify a process inside host.
options.D: Specific-address is used to find an application inside host.

question: Which of the following options is/are TRUE?

options.A: The packet is known by Frame in Data Link Layer.
options.B: The packet is known by Datagram at application Layer.
options.C: The packet is known by segment at Transport Layer.
options.D: The name of packet is different at different Layer due to different header size.

question: Which one of the following is NOT TRUE?

options.A: Circuit switching takes place at physical Layer and uses physical address.
options.B: Datagram switching takes place at network Layer and resources are allocated on demand. question: Which layers of the OSI reference model are host-to-host layers? [ISRO : 2015]

options.A: Transport, session, presentation, application (B) Session, presentation, application
options.C: Datalink, transport, presentation, application (D) Physical, datalink, network, transport

question: The following are names of data units in each layer. Mark the correct choice

options.A: Packet: Data Link Layer (B) Message: Transport Layer
options.C: Bits: Physical Layer (D) None of these

question: Which of the following is NOT TRUE about protocols?

options.A: It is used for flow control (B) It is used to forwards data packet.
options.C: It is used to design OSI Model (D) It is used inside header of data packet.

question: Host A is sending data to host B over a full duplex link. A and B are using the sliding window protocol for flow control. The send and receive window sizes are 5 packets each. Data packets (sent only from A to B) are all 1000 bytes long and the transmission time for such a packet is 50 μs. Acknowledgment packets (sent only from B to A) are very small and require negligible transmission time. The propagation delay over the link is 200 μs. What is the maximum achievable throughput in this communication? [GATE : 2003]

Suppose size of each frame is 1000 bytes and bandwidth of network is 8Mbps. Distance between two connecting node is 1000 km and speed of signal is 2×10(cid:2876) m/s. Which of the following options is/are TRUE?

options.A: The link utilization of channel is almost 10% if Stop & Wait protocol is used.
options.B: The Sequence number bits required for maximum utilization of channel is 3-bits if Go-Back-N protocol is used.
options.C: The possible window size of sender could be 20.
options.D: The Sequence number bits for maximum utilization is 5-bits if Selective Repeat protocol is used.

question: Which of the following statements is TRUE about CSMA/CD : [GATE : 2005]

options.A: IEEE 802.11 wireless LAN runs CSMA/CD protocol
options.B: Ethernet is not based on CSMA/CD protocol
options.C: CSMA/CD is not suitable for a high propagation delay network like satellite network
